translation: Vol. 18

source_sentence: 大唐三藏法師義淨奉　制譯
translation: Translated by the Tripiṭaka Master Yijing of the Great Tang

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「汝等諦聽！
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks, "All of you, listen closely!

source_sentence: 乃往昔時無佛出世，空有辟支佛，時時怜念貧乏，自資少於臥具飲食。
translation: "It was a time when no Buddha appeared in the world and there was an empty pratyekabuddha who was compassionately mindful of the poor and provided little food or drink for his bed.

source_sentence: 時世唯有辟支佛，此時辟支佛遊行，往至波羅痆斯城。
translation: At the time, there was only one Prajñāpāramitā, and he traveled in procession to the city of Vārāṇasī.

source_sentence: 居至一陶家輪舍所，亦有自餘商人等同共止息。
translation: He stayed at a potter's cottage where some other merchants were staying together.

source_sentence: 中有一人夜在房中，遂失大便不淨污地，夜總即去。
translation: One of them was in his room at night and lost his bowels on the impure ground, which he left after the night ended.

source_sentence: 其聲聞緣覺，若不觀察，不預知其事。
translation: Those śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas wouldn't have known about it unless they'd observed it.

source_sentence: 辟支佛夜止宿，擬於明日平旦乞食。
translation: The pratyekabuddha stops for the night and intends to beg for food tomorrow at sunrise.

source_sentence: 主人入房，乃見房中糞污不淨。
translation: When the host enters the room, he sees that it's filthy and impure.

source_sentence: 然而異生愚癡之類不識善惡，便發惡念報辟支曰：『汝出家人，脚不被刺，何因不出房外大便，在此房內而放不淨？』
translation: However, foolish unenlightened sentient beings don't know good from evil, so they give rise to bad thoughts and respond to Pārśva, saying, 'You monks, don't get your feet pricked; why didn't you go outside the room to defecate and leave it here in the room that's unclean?'

source_sentence: 于時主人以鎖鎖門口云：『汝今可於此房餓死。』
translation: The master then locked the door with a lock and said, 'Now you can starve to death in this room.'

source_sentence: 爾時辟支佛作是思惟：『恐此主人後受苦報，我若開門自出，又恐嗔恨。』
translation: It was then that Prakaraṇa Buddha thought, 'I'm afraid this master will suffer the consequences of his actions in the future, and if I open the door and let myself out, I'm afraid of getting angry.'

source_sentence: 默然居住。
translation: He stayed there in silence.

source_sentence: 至中食時，主人嗔息，命辟支曰：『可來喫食。』
translation: When it was time for the midday meal, the host stopped his anger and told Pārśva, 'You may come and eat.'

source_sentence: 告曰：『我時已過更不食也。』
translation: He told him, 'It's past my time, and I won't eat again.'

source_sentence: 『若如是者，今夜更宿，明旦食齋。』
translation: ' 'If that's the case, you'll stay the night and eat tomorrow morning.'

source_sentence: 辟支佛以慈愍而攝受故，便即為住。
translation: Because he was compassionately taken in, the pratyekabuddha then stayed for a while.

source_sentence: 至於明旦，造淨妙食供養辟支。
translation: On the morning, he prepared a pure and wonderful meal to feed Pārśva.

source_sentence: 是時辟支為欲利益此主人故，現身變化而為說法，或現神通，或身上出火，或身下出水，種種變現。
translation: Because he wanted to benefit his master, Pārśva showed himself transformed and preached to him, sometimes displaying supernormal powers, sometimes with fire coming out of his body, sometimes with water coming out of his bottom, and all sorts of other manifestations.

source_sentence: 其時主人見此神變，心切悔過，猶如迅風吹其大樹連根俱拔摧折而倒，此亦如是而自摧撲口云：『大聖！
translation: When the master saw this miraculous transformation, he was so distressed and repentant that he was like a huge tree blown by a swift wind that uprooted and snapped its roots, and so he destroyed himself and said, 'Great sage!

source_sentence: 願暫下來，我今墮在染欲垢中，願慈拔我。』
translation: Please come down for a moment; now I've fallen into the stain of defiled desire; have mercy and remove me.'

source_sentence: 佛更下來，其人禮足口發願言：『於聖者邊而發惡意，願無業報。
translation: When the Buddha came down again, that person bowed his feet and made a vow, saying, 'Wish for no karmic retribution when I arouse ill-will toward the sages.

source_sentence: 又願供養功德善根，於當來世咸得廣大財富自在，亦常供養諸佛如來，心無厭離。』」
translation: May I also make offerings to the virtuous and good roots, so that in a future life I'll attain vast wealth and mastery, and always make offerings to the Tathāgatas and never become disillusioned with them in my mind.'"

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「於汝意云何？
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks, "What do you think?

source_sentence: 爾時陶家人者，今影勝王是。
translation: "At the time, that potter was the present-day King Yingzheng.

source_sentence: 當於爾時向辟支佛，心懷惡意口出麁語，業成熟故，今刀刺脚閉在房中飢渴餓死。
translation: At the time, he spoke harsh words with bad intentions to the pratyekabuddha, and as a result of matured karma, he was stabbed in the leg with a knife and shut up in his room, starving and thirsty, and died of hunger.

source_sentence: 由生悔心發願力故，彼業成熟，得生王宮富貴多財，於世尊所，破二十種身見山峯，以慧穿穴，證得預流果。」
translation: As a result of repentance and the power of their vow, their actions matured, and they were born in a royal palace with wealth and possessions, where the Bhagavān destroyed 20 kinds of bodies, saw a mountain peak, penetrated a cave with wisdom, and realized the fruit of premature flow."

source_sentence: 佛復告諸苾芻等：「行黑業者得黑果報，行白業者當成熟白業果，行黑白雜業者當得黑白雜業報。
translation: The Buddha again addressed the monks, "Those who do black karma will attain the fruit of blackness, those who do white karma will ripen the fruit of white karma, and those who do a mixture of black and white karma will attain the fruit of a mixture of black and white karma.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 當捨黑業及黑白雜業，專修白業行，應如是學。」
translation: You must abandon black karma and the mixed karma of black and white and focus on the practice of white karma; you should train in this way."

source_sentence: 時諸臣佐來白大王：「其老王身今已亡。」
translation: The ministers and assistants then came to the king and said, "The old king has now died."

source_sentence: 聞此語已悶落於地，於時以水灑面還得蘇醒，即入室為父持孝服，無人可諫令得離愁。
translation: After hearing this, he fell to the ground in dismay. He then sprinkled his face with water and regained consciousness, went into his father's room to carry his mourning clothes, and had no one to advise to free him from sorrow.

source_sentence: 時臣佐共議：「云何方便王得無愁？」
translation: The ministers and assistants then all discussed, "How did the king attain freedom from sorrow through skillful means?"

source_sentence: 當時南天竺國有伎樂人來，將至王所作諸伎樂。
translation: At the time, there were musicians from the southern Indian kingdoms who came to the king's apartment to perform music.

source_sentence: 王心無樂，默然不對，不與善言，伎兒總去，遊行至世尊所，告言：「善哉丈夫！」
translation: The king's mind was devoid of joy, so he remained silent and didn't respond. He didn't speak well to them, but the musicians left, wandered over to the Bhagavān, and told him, "Good, Husband!"

source_sentence: 心生歡喜即打鼓作樂。
translation: Delighted, he then beat his drum and made merry.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊自即放光微笑，出種種光又如火星，其光或上或下，其光下至無間地獄。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān himself then radiates a light and smiles, emitting various lights like sparks that either shine up or down and reach down to the unremitting hells.

source_sentence: 光所到處，冷苦者即煖，熱者得清涼。
translation: Where that light reaches, those who are cold and suffering are warmed, and those who are hot are cooled.

source_sentence: 諸受苦者並得止息，皆作思念：「我得託生餘處。」
translation: Those who are suffering are calmed and all think, "I'll be reborn elsewhere."

source_sentence: 佛化一人於地獄中，告言：「汝等亦不託生餘處，為有異人放光明苦得止息。」
translation: The Buddha transforms one person in hell and tells them, "You too will not be entrusted with birth in another place, for some other person will shine their light and bring respite from suffering."

source_sentence: 諸罪人見彼化人，心生歡喜罪得消滅，皆得生人天處所，堪受聽四諦聖法。
translation: Those sinners who see that transformation become happy, their sins are extinguished, and they're all born in heavenly places where they can receive and listen to the noble teaching of the four truths.

source_sentence: 其光上至四天王、三十三天，至阿迦尼吒天，光中說無常、苦、無我、空法頌，其光普照三千大千世界，還隨佛後。
translation: That light reaches up to the four heavenly kings, the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, and the Akaniṣṭha Heaven, where it teaches verses about impermanence, suffering, selflessness, and emptiness, and its light shines universally throughout the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds and returns behind the Buddha.

source_sentence: 若世尊乃至無上菩提事，欲說往昔事時，其光合從後入。
translation: When the Bhagavān or even the task of unsurpassed enlightenment wants to discuss past events, his light will enter from behind.

source_sentence: 若說當來之事，光從前入。
translation: If he were to discuss future events, his light would enter from the front.

source_sentence: 若說地獄事，其光從足下入。
translation: If he wants to talk about the affairs of hell, his light enters at his feet.

source_sentence: 欲說畜生之事，光從脚跟後入。
translation: When he wants to talk about the affairs of animals, the light enters through the back of his heels.

source_sentence: 若說餓鬼之事，光從脚指中入。
translation: If he speaks about the affairs of hungry ghosts, the light enters through his toes.

source_sentence: 若說人間生事，光從脚脛中入。
translation: If he speaks about the affairs of humans, the light enters through the shins of his feet.

source_sentence: 若說轉輪王者，光從左手中滅。
translation: If he speaks about wheel-turning kings, the light goes out from his left hand.

source_sentence: 若說大轉輪王者，光來至右手中滅。
translation: If he speaks of a great wheel-turning king, the light comes to go out in his right hand.

source_sentence: 若說天上之事，光於臍中滅。
translation: If he speaks of heavenly affairs, the light goes out in his navel.

source_sentence: 若說聲聞緣覺之事，光從於臂中滅。
translation: If someone were to teach about the affairs of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas, the light would go out in their arms.

source_sentence: 若說辟支佛法，其光從眉間入。
translation: If he teaches about the teachings of the solitary realizers, the light enters between his eyebrows.

source_sentence: 若說授記無上正真等正覺法，其光從頂入等，廣如前說。
translation: If he taught the Dharma of the prediction of unsurpassed correct and true enlightenment, his light would enter through his crown, and so forth, as explained in detail above.

source_sentence: 時此光明到佛所，遶佛三匝眉間而入。
translation: This light then reached the Buddha, circled him three times between the eyebrows, and entered.

source_sentence: 爾時阿難陀合掌讚佛說伽他等廣說如前。
translation: Ānanda then joined his palms in praise of the Buddha's explanation of the gatha and other things that were explained in detail as before.

source_sentence: 以伽他讚佛：「千妙種種色，　　從口一道出；　遍照於十方，　　亦如日初出。
translation: He praised the Buddha with these words, "A thousand wonderful forms emanate from one mouth, and they shine everywhere in the ten directions like the first rays of the sun.

source_sentence: 無我而說偈，　　聞者除憍慢；　皆作佛因緣，　　無緣不放光，　降伏諸怨等。」
translation: Speaking a verse without self, those who hear it are freed from conceit; they all serve as causes and conditions for the Buddha, don't emit light without conditions, and subdue enemies and so forth."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難陀：「汝見彼伎兒於我歡喜打鼓作樂不？」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Do you see that musician rejoicing in me, beating his drum and making merry?"

source_sentence: 阿難陀白佛言：「我見也。」
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, "I've seen it."

source_sentence: 佛復告阿難陀言：「此伎兒得辟支佛果，名雅和音。」
translation: The Buddha again told Ānanda, "This musician has attained the fruit of pratyekabuddha, which is called elegant harmony sound."

source_sentence: 爾時提婆達多語未生怨王：「我以教汝今得王位，今須建立令我作佛。」
translation: It was then that Devadatta said to the king of the unborn resentments, "I taught you to attain the position of king now; now you must establish me as a buddha."

source_sentence: 時王語提婆達多言：「佛身有金色，汝身無金色。
translation: The king then said to Devadatta, "The body of the Buddha has gold, but yours doesn't have gold.

source_sentence: 若為建立令作佛耶？」
translation: What if you were to establish it so that you would become a buddha?"

source_sentence: 復白王言：「我身作金色，斯亦可得。」
translation: Again, he said to the king, "I can make my body gold, and this will be possible."

source_sentence: 其提婆達多即喚金匠報言：「於我身上令作金色。」
translation: Devadatta then summoned the goldsmith and reported, "Make my body gold."

source_sentence: 金匠答曰：「聖者！
translation: The goldsmith replied, "Noble one!

source_sentence: 若能忍痛即可作得。」
translation: If you can tolerate pain, you'll be able to do it."

source_sentence: 答曰：「我能忍痛。」
translation: He replied, "I can tolerate pain."

source_sentence: 金匠即以熱油塗身，受諸辛苦著金薄塗身。
translation: The goldsmith then rubbed hot oil on his body and applied thin layers of gold to his body to endure the pain.

source_sentence: 別有苾芻問孤迦里迦苾芻曰：「提婆達多今者何在？」
translation: A certain monk asked the monk Krakucchanda, "Where's Devadatta now?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「為染身金色不在。」
translation: He replied, "The gold color in his defiled body is not present."

source_sentence: 時彼苾芻聞已，即往彼看提婆達多，見受諸辛苦叫喚為身上金色。
translation: After the monk heard this, he went over to see Devadatta and saw him undergoing all that hard labor and calling out that his body was golden.

source_sentence: 苾芻即來白佛言：「其提婆達多，為身欲作金色受大辛苦。」
translation: The monk then came to the Buddha and said, "That Devadatta wants to make his body gold because he's undergoing great suffering."

source_sentence: 佛告苾芻言：「時提婆達多，非是今時為身金色辛苦，於往昔時為金帽辛苦至死。
translation: The Buddha told the monk, "Not now does Devadatta suffer from gold on his body, but in the past, he suffered from gold hats until he died.

source_sentence: 往昔之時於婆羅痆斯城，有一婦人，夫主遠行不在。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a woman in the city of Vārāṇasī whose husband was away on a trip.

source_sentence: 有一烏鳥來彼婦人前和美語聲。
translation: A crow came to that woman and spoke in harmony with her voice.

source_sentence: 其婦人言：『如汝美聲我婿平安早到，與汝金帽。』
translation: The woman said, 'According to your beautiful voice, my son-in-law will arrive safely and early and give you a gold hat.'

source_sentence: 不久中間夫婿到來平安至家，其烏復於彼婦人前還作美聲。
translation: Soon afterward, her son-in-law arrived home safely, and the crow again made a beautiful noise in front of the woman.

source_sentence: 時彼婦人即擲金帽與烏，得已即東去西。
translation: The woman then tossed her gold hat to the crow, and after she got it, she went east and west.

source_sentence: 別有鵄鳥為彼金帽，打彼烏頭落地而死。」
translation: Some other bird took her gold hat, struck the crow's head on the ground, and killed it."

source_sentence: 佛言：「爾時烏鳥者，今提婆達多是。」
translation: The Buddha said, "At the time, that crow was the present-day Devadatta."

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「於意云何？
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "What do you think?

source_sentence: 此提婆達多，於往昔時為金帽故，有如是習性仍在，為彼金薄身受其辛苦。」
translation: This Devadatta, who in the past had such a habit because of his gold hat, still suffers the hardships of a thin gold body for that person."

source_sentence: 又提婆達多白未生怨王言：「我建立王今得王位，須立我為佛。」
translation: Again, Devadatta said to the king of unborn enemies, "I established that the king has now attained the position of king and must be made a buddha."

source_sentence: 王言：「如來脚下有妙輪相，若為建立得號為佛？」
translation: The king said, "Is there a wonderful wheel shape under the Tathāgata's feet, and if I were to establish it, would I be called a Buddha?"

source_sentence: 提婆達多復白王言：「我能作足下輪相。」
translation: Devadatta then said to the king, "I can make the shape of a wheel under my feet."

source_sentence: 時提婆達多，即召巧工問言：「汝頗能於我雙足下作輪相不？」
translation: Devadatta then summoned the skilled laborer and asked, "Will you create the wheel marks beneath my feet?"

source_sentence: 其人答曰：「聖者！
translation: The man replied, "Sage!

source_sentence: 若欲能受痛，我當為作。」
translation: If I want to be able to feel pain, I will do it for you."

source_sentence: 提婆達多言：「我能忍痛。」
translation: Devadatta said, "I can endure the pain."

source_sentence: 時匠念言：「其人有大氣力，若拓印時脚跟踏我，必因茲致死。」
translation: The smith then thought, "That man has great energy; if his heel strikes me while he's making the impression, it will surely kill him."

source_sentence: 便即語提婆達多言：「可向房中出脚，我即印上。」
translation: He then said to Devadatta, "You can put your foot out into the room, and I'll put my seal on it."

source_sentence: 答匠言：「好。」
translation: He answered the smith, "Yes."

source_sentence: 時匠即燒輪形鐵，如火色印其足下，其時受太辛苦。
translation: The smith then burned a wheel-shaped iron the color of fire and stamped it under his foot, and it was too hard for him to bear.

source_sentence: 時有苾芻來問孤迦里迦言：「其提婆達多今見何在？」
translation: A monk then came to Kauṇḍinya and asked, "Where does that Devadatta see him now?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「今在一處作脚輪相。」
translation: He answered, "Now, I'm in a place where I'm making the shape of a footstool."

source_sentence: 時彼苾芻往彼房所，看提婆達多。
translation: That monk then went to that house and looked at Devadatta.

source_sentence: 至彼見提婆達多，為作脚輪相，燒脚受大辛苦，痛聲叫喚。
translation: When he arrived, he saw Devadatta making the shape of a wheel of feet, burning his feet and suffering great pain as he cried out in pain.

source_sentence: 時彼苾芻，心生疑怪往如來所，唯佛能斷疑惑，白言：「世尊！
translation: That monk then became suspicious and went to the Tathāgata, saying, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我見提婆達多，為作脚輪相，受大辛苦疼痛。」
translation: I've seen Devadatta create the characteristic of a foot-wheel and experience great pain and suffering."

source_sentence: 佛告苾芻：「往昔之時亦為脚受苦，習性仍在。
translation: The Buddha told the monk, "In the past, he also suffered for his feet, and his habits are still there.

source_sentence: 如往昔時，雪山之中有一大象，下山飲水。
translation: It was like in the past when there was a huge elephant in the snowy mountains that went down to drink water.

source_sentence: 有一野犴隨象後行，見象脚跡自作量度，我於此沒當生天上。
translation: A wild jail followed the elephant and saw its footprints and thought to itself, 'I'll be born up in heaven if I disappear here.'

source_sentence: 因茲跳擲，忽被枯木以查其身，遂便至死。」
translation: He jumped and threw himself, and suddenly he was checked by a withered log, which brought him to his death."

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「於汝意云何？
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks, "What do you think?

source_sentence: 時彼野犴即提婆達多是。
translation: At the time, that wild jail was Devadatta.

source_sentence: 當於爾時度量脚跡忘作觀意，今時還為脚輪受大苦痛。」
translation: At the time, he measured the footprints of his feet and forgot to contemplate them, but now he'll suffer great pain because of the footprints."

source_sentence: 時佛世尊在王舍城住耆闍崛山深遠藥叉宮中，時提婆達多白未生怨王：「我今立汝為王，汝可立我為佛。
translation: The Bhagavān was staying in the city of Rājagṛha at the Yakṣa Palace deep in the Gṛdhrakūṭa Mountains when Devadatta said to the king of the unarisen enemies, "Now, I've made you king, so you can make me a Buddha.

source_sentence: 然我今欲殺沙門喬答摩，王宜共我設諸方計。
translation: Now, however, I want to kill the ascetic Gautama, so it would be appropriate for the king to work out various plans with me.

source_sentence: 我今不知以何物打？
translation: Now, I don't know what I'll strike with.

source_sentence: 先打何處而令命終？」
translation: Where should I strike first so that my life will end?"

source_sentence: 時有工巧，能造拋車，從南天竺國來至城中。
translation: A skilled worker who could build a chariot came from the southern kingdom of India and arrived in the city.

source_sentence: 提婆達多聞已，即命巧工告曰：「汝能造五百人所牽拋車不？」
translation: After he heard about it, Devadatta ordered the artisan to tell him, "Can you build a throwing chariot for 500 people?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我今善解造此拋車。」
translation: He replied, "Now, I'll build this chariot with good understanding."

source_sentence: 時提婆達多便即持咽珠價直千金而與巧工令造此車，復與一千人以為驅使，報巧工曰：「佛在鷲峯山，汝今應可於其山上近佛坐處安五百人拋車。
translation: Devadatta then took the throat pearl, which cost a thousand pieces of gold, and gave it to the skilled laborer to build the chariot. He also gave it to a thousand people to drive, and he told the skilled laborer, "The Buddha is on Vulture Peak, so now you can place a chariot for 500 people on that mountain near where the Buddha is sitting.

source_sentence: 復於餘處安二百五十人拋車。
translation: Then, you could place 250 people on the other side to throw the chariot.

source_sentence: 又復餘處令更安二百五十人拋車。」
translation: At another place, you can place another 250 people throwing chariots."

source_sentence: 告諸人曰：「汝等應知，沙門喬答摩遊行來去，即以拋車打令斷命。」
translation: He told the people, "You should know that when the ascetic Gautama marches back and forth, he beats them with a chariot and causes them to lose their lives."

source_sentence: 時彼人等受提婆達多教已，即詣鷲峯山上，造五百人拋車畢。
translation: After they had been instructed by Devadatta, they went up to Vulture Peak and finished building a chariot for 500 people to throw.

source_sentence: 時五百人共相議曰：「造此大拋車欲害世尊。」
translation: The five hundred men then conferred with each other, "They want to harm the Bhagavān by building this huge chariot."

source_sentence: 悉作是言：「汝等應知，寧各捨命，不害人天所共恭敬大聖世尊身。」
translation: They all said, "You should know better than to sacrifice your lives to harm the body of the great sage Bhagavān, whom humans and gods jointly venerate."

source_sentence: 作是語已即捨拋車，便從山頂求覓僻路而下，恐提婆達多見。
translation: After saying this, he then left the chariot and went down from the top of the mountain, seeking a secluded path, lest Devadatta see it.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知諸人所念，便化階道，眾人見已各相議曰：「此峻高山先無階道，汝等應當知，此是世尊威德。」
translation: Knowing what they were thinking, the Bhagavān then created a path, and when the people saw it, they each discussed it with one another, saying, "This high mountain had no path in the past; you should know that this is the Bhagavān's authoritative power."

source_sentence: 于時諸人於佛如來發大清信，便於階道而下至世尊所。
translation: Those people then had great pure faith in the Buddha as Tathāgata and went down the steps to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊為彼諸人欲調伏故，經行鷲峯山，既至佛所頂禮雙足退坐一面，欲聽法故。
translation: Because they wanted to tame them, the Bhagavān traveled up Vulture Peak, then saluted the Buddha's feet as he reached him and withdrew to sit at one side, wanting to listen to the teaching.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知彼根性意樂隨眠，為說如是四諦令其開悟。
translation: Knowing their faculties, aspirations, and latencies, the Bhagavān then explained these four truths for them to awaken.

source_sentence: 彼既聞已，以智金剛杵即能摧碎二十種薩迦耶見山，證預流果。
translation: After hearing them, he used the vajra of wisdom to smash through twenty mountains of religious views and realize the fruit of stream-winner.

source_sentence: 既見諦已白佛言：「大德！
translation: After seeing these truths, he said to the Buddha, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 由佛世尊令我證得解脫之果，此非父母、人王、天眾、沙門、婆羅門、親友、眷屬之所能作。
translation: The Bhagavān has made me realize the fruit of liberation, which is not something that parents, human kings, gods, ascetics, priests, relatives, friends, or retinues can do.

source_sentence: 我遇世尊善知識故，於地獄、傍生、餓鬼趣中拔濟令出，安置人天勝妙之處，當盡生死而得涅槃，超越骨山乾竭血海，無始積集二十薩迦耶見，以金剛智杵而摧碎之，得預流果。
translation: Because I met a Bhagavān, a good teacher, I was rescued from hell, the destinies of unliving beings and hungry ghosts, placed in a wonderful place among humans and gods, where I'll end birth and death and attain nirvāṇa, transcend mountains of bones, dry seas of blood, and the twenty views of the ācārya that I've accumulated since time immemorial, and crush them with a vajra-wise pounder to attain the fruit of pre-flow.

source_sentence: 我今歸依佛法僧寶，受五學處，始從今日乃至命終，不殺生乃至不飲酒。
translation: Now, I've reverted to the treasures of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha and accepted the five abodes of training, starting today and continuing until the end of my life, not to kill beings or even drink alcohol.

source_sentence: 唯願世尊證知，我是鄔波索迦。」
translation: Please let the Bhagavān realize that I am upāsaka."

source_sentence: 是時工師情謂害佛，便持咽珠私自逃走。
translation: The worker then said that he was harming the Buddha, so he took his throat beads and fled on his own.

source_sentence: 時提婆達多數數遙望，謂佛世尊頭以落地，見佛安然了無損害。
translation: Devadatta then looked out several times, saying, "The Bhagavān's head fell to the ground, and he saw the Buddha standing perfectly still, unscathed.

source_sentence: 覩五百人佛所聽法，遂起嗔恨餘路登山，乃見工師持珠私走，因此自更將五百人欲發拋車。
translation: Seeing the 500 people the Buddha was listening to teach, he became angry and climbed the mountain the rest of the way. Seeing the worker take the pearl and leave on his own, he then proceeded to throw the 500 people off the chariot.

source_sentence: 佛作此念：「是我宿業積集成熟業報來至，欲水暴流無能止息退。
translation: The Buddha had this thought, "This is the result of my accumulated and matured karma from prior lifetimes, and there's no way to stop the torrential flow of desire and retreat.

source_sentence: 自作自受，若他受者無有是處。」
translation: There's no place for someone who makes their own retribution or for someone else to receive it."

source_sentence: 佛知業已告五百人曰：「諸仁當知！
translation: After the Buddha knew about the karma, he told the five hundred people, "You should know, you gentlemen!

source_sentence: 提婆達多甚惡意，欲將汝等身登鷲峯山，此是我業決定須受，可共前進。」
translation: Devadatta is very vicious and wants to take you all up Vulture Peak, for this is something I'm sure I have to do, so let's go forward together."

source_sentence: 時諸天等便觀下方，于時執金剛藥叉便作是念：「此提婆達多既興惡逆欲害如來。」
translation: The gods then looked down, and Vajra Yakṣa then had this thought in his mind, "This Devadatta has committed a heinous act intended to harm the Tathāgata."

source_sentence: 作是念已，即往金毘羅藥叉宮，報藥叉曰：「提婆達多於鷲峯山頂造大撞車，飛大拋石欲害佛身。
translation: After that thought, he went to the palace of Kimbila Yakṣa and reported to Yakṣa, "At the top of Vulture Peak, Devadatta built a huge chariot and flew a huge rock-throwing vehicle in an attempt to harm the Buddha's body.

source_sentence: 世尊既在汝宮安住，提婆達多正發石之時，我當以金剛杵於虛空中而摧碎之，汝應相助；恐有碎石迸著佛身，汝應覆護。」
translation: Now that the Bhagavān is staying at your palace, when Devadatta is throwing rocks, I will use my vajra to break them in the sky, so you should help me; I'm afraid some of the broken rocks will fall on the Buddha's body, so you should protect it."

source_sentence: 金毘羅曰：「善哉！
translation: Kimbila said, "Good!

source_sentence: 如是。」
translation: So it is."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊從座而起，將入深山巖穴之內。
translation: The Bhagavān then got up from his seat and was about to enter a deep mountain cave.

source_sentence: 于時提婆達多與五百人發機飛石直擊如來。
translation: Devadatta and 500 others then had the opportunity to send flying rocks straight at the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 時執金剛神以金剛杵於虛空中打石令碎，其石一片欲墮佛身。
translation: The vajra-wielding deity then struck the rock with a vajra pounder in the sky, causing it to break apart, and a piece of it was about to fall on the Buddha's body.

source_sentence: 時金毘羅藥叉接石不著，遂打自身，從斯迸落損世尊足。
translation: The Kimbila Yakṣa then caught the stone and didn't touch it, so he struck himself, and it burst down and injured the Bhagavān's feet.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊即說頌曰：「非在虛空中，　　非海非山穴；　無有地方所，　　能免於業報。」
translation: The Bhagavān then spoke a verse, "It's not in the sky, it's not the ocean, and it's not a mountain cave; there's no place where it can escape the effects of karma."

source_sentence: 時金毘羅藥叉被石擊身自知必死，便發善念：「命終之後生三十三天。」
translation: When the stone struck Kimbila Yakṣa's body, he knew he was certain to die and then had a good thought, "After my life ends, I'll be born in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven."

source_sentence: 諸天常法，得生天已起三種念：一者今在何處？
translation: After being born in the heavens, there are three kinds of thoughts that arise according to the eternal laws of the gods: First, where are we now?

source_sentence: 二者因何得生？
translation: What are the causes for the birth of the two?

source_sentence: 三者復因何業而得生此？
translation: Third, what other activity did it take to get born here?

source_sentence: 既審觀已知是天處。
translation: He has carefully observed and known this to be the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 復知前世身為藥叉，於佛世尊發清淨意，得生廣勝三十三天。
translation: They also knew that in a previous life they'd been a yakṣa and that the Bhagavān had aroused a pure intention to be born in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven.

source_sentence: 復作是念：「我得生天，不應經宿受茲妙樂然後見佛，宜時速往敬禮世尊。」
translation: Again, he thought, "Now that I've been born in that heaven, I shouldn't have gone through all this time to experience these wonderful pleasures before seeing the Buddha; it's time to quickly go and venerate the Bhagavān."

source_sentence: 作是念已，即於身手遍嚴瓔珞殊特妙好，并持四種蔓陀羅等微妙蓮花，其天首髮柔軟香潔右旋紺青，身相端嚴不可比喻，威儀庠序下鷲峯山，以天威力光明赫奕遍照山野。
translation: After that thought, he then adorned his body and hands with jewelry of exceptional beauty and carried four subtle lotus flowers like the vandana, whose hair was soft and fragrant, whose body was dignified and incomparable, and whose demeanor was peaceful as he descended Vulture Peak and shone brilliantly throughout the mountains and fields with the might of the gods.

source_sentence: 詣佛所已，散華供養退坐一面，為聞法故。
translation: After visiting the Buddha, he scattered flowers, made offerings, and withdrew to sit at one side, intending to hear the teaching.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知彼根性意樂隨眠，為說如是四真諦法，令其開悟。
translation: Knowing his faculties, inclinations, and latencies, the Bhagavān then explained these four true truths to him, causing him to awaken.

source_sentence: 彼聞法已，以智金剛杵摧壞二十有身見山，證預流果。
translation: After hearing the teaching, he used the vajra of wisdom to destroy 20 mountains of belief in the existence of bodies and realize the fruit of stream-winner.

source_sentence: 既見諦已三白言：「大德！
translation: After he saw the truths, he said three times, "Maestro!

source_sentence: 由佛世尊，令我證得解脫之果。
translation: The Bhagavān has made me realize the fruit of liberation.

source_sentence: 此非父母、人王、天眾、沙門、婆羅門、親友、眷屬之所能作。
translation: This is not something that parents, human kings, gods, ascetics, priests, relatives, friends, or retinues can do.

source_sentence: 我遇世尊善知識故，於地獄、傍生、餓鬼趣中拔濟令出，安置人天勝妙之處，當盡生死而得涅槃，超越骨山乾竭血海，無始積集薩迦耶見，以智金剛杵而摧碎之，得預流果。
translation: Because I met the Bhagavān, a good teacher, I was rescued from hell, the rebirths of animals, and the destinies of hungry ghosts, placed in a wonderful place among humans and gods, where I'll end birth and death and attain nirvāṇa, transcend mountains of bones and seas of dried-up blood, and accumulate the view of identity of the ācārya from beginningless time, and crush it with a vajra of wisdom to attain the fruit of pre-flow.

source_sentence: 我今歸依佛法僧寶，受五學處，始從今日乃至命終，更不殺生乃至不飲酒。
translation: Now, I've reverted to the treasures of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha and accepted the five abodes of training, starting today and continuing until the end of my life, never to kill another living soul or even drink alcohol.

source_sentence: 唯願世尊證知，我是鄔波索迦。」
translation: Please let the Bhagavān realize that I am upāsaka."

source_sentence: 即於佛前而說頌曰：「世尊威力彌弘廣，　　閉塞堅牢惡趣門，　開示妙善生天路。
translation: He then spoke a verse before the Buddha, saying, "The Bhagavān's might is so vast that it closes the door to the hard and fast path to evil destinies and opens the path to birth in heaven for the wonderfully good.

source_sentence: 我今獲得無為果，　親承諸佛大慈悲，　　眾惡皆除得天眼。」
translation: Now, I've attained the fruit of nothingness, personally acknowledging the great compassion of the buddhas, and I've attained the divine eye for ridding myself of all evil."

source_sentence: 是時前身藥叉天神，如商人得利、如耕夫收實、如戰者得勝、如病得除，依舊威儀禮佛而去。
translation: The former Yakṣa gods then, like merchants who reap profits, plowmen who reap their harvest, warriors who win victories, and those who are freed from illness, paid homage to the Buddha in their usual manner and departed.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻始從初夜至後夜分，各自禪念，忽見佛前光明遍照，皆生疑惑詣佛請白：「有何因緣？
translation: After meditating separately from the beginning of the evening until the latter part of the evening, the monks suddenly saw a bright light shining everywhere in front of the Buddha, and they all had doubts and asked the Buddha, "What are the causes and conditions?

source_sentence: 梵釋諸天四天大王眾，來此奉覲。」
translation: The Brahmadeva gods and the four celestial kings are here to pay their respects."

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「此非梵天，亦非帝釋四天王眾來此謁我，由提婆達多於鷲峯山作大拋車飛石打我，執金剛神以金剛杵空中打碎，時金毘羅藥叉接承不得，遂打自身。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "This is not the Brahmā gods, nor is it the four celestial kings of Indra who came to see me because Devadatta made a huge chariot on Vulture Peak and flew a rock at me, and the vajra god used a vajra to smash it in the air.

source_sentence: 因發善心命終之後，得生廣勝三十三天，緣此故來稽首於我。
translation: After his life ended because of his good intentions, he was born in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, and it was because of that that he came to visit me.

source_sentence: 我為說法，得見真諦歸還天已。
translation: After I taught him the Dharma and made him see the true truth, he returned to heaven.

source_sentence: 是故苾芻！
translation: Therefore, monks!

source_sentence: 若作黑業得黑果，作純白業得純白果，若作雜業必受雜果。
translation: If you do black karma, you'll get the result of blackness, and if you do pure white karma, you'll get the result of pure whiteness, and if you do mixed karma, you'll surely receive mixed results.

source_sentence: 宜捨黑雜業唯集白業，當如是學。」
translation: It's better to abandon black and mixed actions and gather only white actions; you should train in this way."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻皆生疑惑而白佛言：「金毘羅藥叉為護佛故自喪身命。」
translation: The monks then all had doubts and said to the Buddha, "Kimbila Yakṣa took his own life to protect the Buddha."

source_sentence: 佛言：「非但今日為我喪命，於過去生亦為我故自喪身命。
translation: The Buddha said, "Not only did he lose his life for me today, but he also lost his life for my sake in past lives.

source_sentence: 汝應善聽！
translation: You should listen well!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔波羅痆斯國有王名曰梵授，正法理國無諸枉濫。
translation: Once upon a time there was a king in the country of Pārāṇas, named Brahmadatta, who taught the correct Dharma and principle without abuse.

source_sentence: 時世清淨人無災害，五穀豐盈萬姓安樂。
translation: At the time, the world was pure, people were not harmed, and grains were plentiful for the well-being of all families.

source_sentence: 當爾之時去城不遠有別聚落，多諸園林勝妙花果，雜類諸鳥和鳴可愛。
translation: At the time, there was a separate village not far from the city, with many parks and forests of wonderful flowers and fruits, and a variety of birds that chirped in harmony and were lovely.

source_sentence: 時有仙人住此林內，絕粒苦行唯食根果，被樹皮衣以禦寒暑。
translation: An immortal then lived in this forest, cutting off grains of food and practicing austerities while eating only roots and fruits, and he wore a bark robe to keep out the cold and heat.

source_sentence: 即於此處有一獵師，每持弓矢殺諸禽獸而自存養。
translation: At that place, there was a hunter who used to carry a bow and spear to kill animals and keep them alive.

source_sentence: 而此獵師於時林間往仙人所，仙見歲寒往來疲乏，心生愍念，乃將根果與之令食，遂結恩義共為父子。
translation: When this hunter went to the sage in the forest at the time, the sage saw how cold it was going to be, how tired he was going to be, and how compassionate he was, so he gave him the roots and fruits to eat, and they became father and son.

source_sentence: 是時獵師敬事仙人稱之為父，仙亦憐愍愛之如子。
translation: The hunter then honored the sage and called him father, and the sage had compassion for him and loved him as his son.

source_sentence: 後於異時其梵授王清晨縱觀入鹿園中，時有野鹿驚怖悲鳴急投仙人，時王即便射殺此鹿。
translation: At another time, the Brahmā king looked into a deer park early in the morning and saw a wild deer that cried out in fear and pity and rushed to throw itself at the sage, and the king then even shot and killed the deer.

source_sentence: 既見命終，仙乃發憤報彼王曰：『汝之惡性深非道理，彼鹿投我輒事屠害。』
translation: Seeing his life end, the sage became angry and retaliated to the king, saying, 'Your evil nature is so profoundly unreasonable that you would easily slaughter that deer if it threw itself at me.'

source_sentence: 時王聞已極生瞋恚告諸臣曰：『若有世人於灌頂剎帝王加麁惡語，合科何罪？』
translation: After hearing this, the king became extremely angry and told his ministers, 'If a person had spoken harshly to the emperor at Gautama, what crime would that have been?'

source_sentence: 群臣白王：『非法惡人合當死罪。』
translation: The ministers said to the king, 'Unlawful and unwholesome people deserve death.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『然此仙人輕毀於我。』
translation: The king said, 'Still, this sage has despised me.'

source_sentence: 其時群臣欲害仙人，獵師近見便作是念：『我見命存，豈彼敢害大仙人也。』
translation: The ministers then wanted to harm the sage, but when the hunter came near, he thought, 'How could he dare to harm a great sage when I see that his life depends on it?'

source_sentence: 是時獵師即共決戰，仙人避走。
translation: The hunters then engaged in a common battle, and the sage took refuge.

source_sentence: 時王爾時有大威勢，其時獵師便被王殺害。」
translation: The king then had great authority, and the hunter was killed by the king."

source_sentence: 佛言：「諸苾芻！
translation: The Buddha said, "Precious monks!

source_sentence: 汝意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 時仙人者我身是也。
translation: "The time-honored sage is myself.

source_sentence: 時獵師者，即前身藥叉天神是也。
translation: The time-hunter was the former Yakṣa god.

source_sentence: 當於爾時，已為我故喪失身命。
translation: At the time, he had already lost his body and life for my sake.

source_sentence: 今還為我遂便致死，石打我足流血如是不絕。」
translation: Now, he's still going to cause death for me, beating my feet with a stone and bleeding like this."

source_sentence: 世尊忍痛，爾時醫王侍縛迦，每日三時來詣佛所，其王舍城人及諸國商人貧富貴賤有信心正見者，皆與醫王同往佛所。
translation: The Bhagavān endured the pain, and at the time, the king of doctors, Squire Vaka, came to the Buddha three times a day, and the merchants of Rājagṛha and other countries, rich and poor, and those with faith and right views all went with the king of doctors to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 時諸眾人白醫王言：「作何醫方？」
translation: The people then said to the king of doctors, "What's the cure?"

source_sentence: 醫王答言：「我解此方，其藥難得。」
translation: The king replied, "I understand this prescription, but its medicine is difficult to obtain."

source_sentence: 時阿難陀問醫王曰：「是何藥草，難可求得？」
translation: Ānanda then asked the king of doctors, "What is this herb that's difficult to obtain?"

source_sentence: 答言：「此方用牛頭栴檀香，我先已於諸處求覓不得，縱令商人有者，怕未生怨王惡性，不敢出賣。
translation: He replied, "I've searched everywhere for the fragrance of ox-head sandalwood, but even if a merchant had it, he wouldn't dare to sell it for fear that he might become hostile to the king.

source_sentence: 王若須者，方始將出獻王。
translation: If the king needs it, then I'll present it to him.

source_sentence: 王若須香之日，無可與王必定被殺。
translation: On the day the king needs the incense, I won't be able to offer it to him, but I'll surely be killed.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 為曾賣栴檀香來，已知有其香故。」
translation: It's because they once sold sandalwood incense and knew it was there."

source_sentence: 時賣香商人在其眾中，聞侍縛迦所說，為世尊治病故，須栴檀香，便作是念：「未生怨王共提婆達多親愛，於世尊相嫉。
translation: When the merchant who sold the incense was among them and heard what Squire Vṛkṣa said about needing sandalwood incense to treat the Bhagavān's illness, he thought, "The king of unborn enemies and Devadatta are close friends, and they're jealous of the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 若聞我與世尊牛頭栴檀香時，定當損我。」
translation: If they hear that I've given the Bhagavān oxhead sandalwood incense, they'll surely harm me."

source_sentence: 復作是念：「世尊是諸人天應供，我為此縱其身命被損，亦須奉上如來牛頭栴檀香。」
translation: Again, he thought, "The Bhagavān is an offering to humans and gods, and even if my life were to be harmed for this, I would still have to present the Tathāgata with ox-head sandalwood incense."

source_sentence: 即往取香來供養佛，[跍*月]跪白言：「世尊！
translation: He went, took the incense, offered it to the Buddha, and knelt down and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我得栴檀香來，世尊慈愍須當受取。」
translation: I've obtained the fragrance of sandalwood, which the Bhagavān, in his compassion, must accept."

source_sentence: 佛告具壽阿難陀言：「此大仁邊為受取栴檀香。」
translation: The Buddha told Kauṣṭhila Ānanda, "This is a great benefactor who would accept the fragrance of sandalwood."

source_sentence: 依命受得。
translation: He did as instructed and received it.

source_sentence: 商人生大歡喜，頭面禮佛退而還去。
translation: The merchant became greatly elated, bowed his head to the Buddha's face, and withdrew.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊微笑，有五色光現青黃赤白，皆從口出，乃至其光於眉間入。
translation: The Bhagavān then smiled, and a five-colored light appeared, blue, yellow, red, and white, all coming out of his mouth, up to his light entering between his eyebrows.

source_sentence: 廣如上說。
translation: It was explained in detail above.

source_sentence: 時阿難陀以偈讚佛，廣說如前。
translation: Ānanda then praised the Buddha in a verse, which was explained in detail as before.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難陀：「汝見彼商人心生歡喜，以牛頭栴檀香供養於我不？」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Do you rejoice when you see that merchant and offer me the scent of oxhead sandalwood?"

source_sentence: 阿難陀白佛言：「我見。」
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, "I see that."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難陀：「如彼商人，以無量善根敬信，捨施牛頭栴檀香，於未來世當證辟支佛果，名曰栴檀。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Suppose that merchant honors faith with measureless good roots and gives away the fragrance of oxhead sandalwood, for in a future life he'll realize the fruit of a pratyekabuddha named sandalwood.

source_sentence: 因於我處生大歡喜，當得是報。」
translation: Because of this, he'll become very happy in my place and will obtain this reward."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊得此檀香塗足，血猶不止。
translation: The Bhagavān then had this sandalwood incense applied to his feet, and his blood still wouldn't stop.

source_sentence: 侍縛迦復白佛言：「用童女人乳汁塗點瘡上。」
translation: Again, Svabhākar said to the Buddha, "Use the milk of a young woman to rub a spot on a sore."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻心怪不識童女乳汁，時具壽阿難陀問侍縛迦言：「何者是名童女乳汁？」
translation: The monks were puzzled and didn't recognize the milk of a young woman, so Kauṣṭhila Ānanda asked Gavāṃpati, "What's this called the milk of a young woman?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「若婦人初妊胎生子者，是名童女乳汁。」
translation: They replied, "If a woman's first pregnancy gives birth to a child, this is called the milk of a virgin."

source_sentence: 爾時四眾往詣諸處，求覓童女乳汁，在王舍城中除提婆達多及諸近友，於餘外四眾處，皆求此乳。
translation: It was then that four people went to various places to seek the milk of a young woman, and in the city of Rājagṛha, except for Devadatta and his close friends, four other people sought this milk.

source_sentence: 其提婆達多及諸惡友唱言：「汝等勿與乳汁。」
translation: Devadatta and his evil friends said, "Don't give them the milk!"

source_sentence: 當欲作厭魅幻化之法，自無與心障破一切人。
translation: They then wanted to do something that was disgusting, illusory, and selfless, and their minds were obstructed by all people.

source_sentence: 爾時是王舍城中唯有一婦人，身自瘦小，初生孩子身亦瘦小，其母乳汁子食猶不得足，況故更與他人。
translation: At the time, there was only one woman in the city of Rājagṛha who was thin and small, and her newborn child was also thin and small, so her mother's milk wasn't enough to feed her child, so why would she give it to another person?

source_sentence: 時彼婦人聞佛世尊須童女乳汁，便作是念：「我若以用乳供養如來，我自瘦弱多有禍起：一者子當必死、二者提婆達多與王親近，及有宿舊朋友，聞與乳必當殺我。」
translation: When that woman heard that the Bhagavān needed milk from a young woman, she thought, "If I were to offer milk to the Tathāgata, my own thinness would cause me many misfortunes: first, my child would surely die, and second, Devadatta, who's close to the king and has old friends, would surely kill me if they heard that milk was given."

source_sentence: 復作是念：「若我身死并我子亡，為天人應供養者，念患足指疼痛，我當持乳將供養如來。」
translation: Again, she thought, "If I were to die physically and my son were to die, and I were to become an offering to gods and humans, I would bring milk and make offerings to the Tathāgata, thinking that I'm suffering from pain in my toes."

source_sentence: 時彼婦人出乳置於銅器中，持將往如來所，頭面禮足[跍*月]跪奉佛，白言：「世尊！
translation: The woman then took out the milk, put it in a copper vessel, took it over to the Tathāgata, bowed her head and feet [to the moon], knelt down, and presented it to the Buddha, saying, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我將女乳來，聞佛須童女乳，我今將來，願佛受取此乳。」
translation: I brought the milk of a woman here and heard that the Buddha needs the milk of a young woman, so now I'll come and wish that the Buddha would accept this milk."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「此女人心懷正信，汝當受取此乳。」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "This woman has right faith in her heart, so you must accept this milk."

source_sentence: 時阿難陀依命受得，婦人頭面禮佛退還而去。
translation: Ananta then complied with the order and accepted it. The woman bowed her head to the Buddha's face and withdrew.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊微笑放五色光，其光遍滿三千，廣如上說。
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān smiled and emitted a five-colored light that filled 3,000 [square miles] and was as detailed above.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難陀言：「汝見彼女人將乳來供養我不？」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Do you see that woman offering her milk to me?"

source_sentence: 阿難陀白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我見。」
translation: I see."

source_sentence: 佛復告阿難陀：「此人以歡喜心捨施乳來供養於我，以此無量善根，當來之世得證辟支佛果。」
translation: The Buddha again told Ānanda, "This person's joyful giving of milk as an offering to me will have measureless good roots that will lead to the realization of pratyekabuddhahood in a future life."

source_sentence: 時佛世尊瀝乳塗瘡血流不息，諸方苾芻及梵志等，聞佛患瘡皆來佛所，或有塗香粖香安於瘡上，種種醫療竟不能差。
translation: When the Bhagavān leaked milk and smeared sores with blood that wouldn't stop flowing, monks and priests from various directions who heard that the Buddha was suffering from sores came to the Buddha, or they put scented incense or oil on the sores, but the various treatments couldn't heal them.

source_sentence: 爾時具壽十力迦攝波，以真實語發大誓願：「若佛世尊，於一切眾生普作子想，實不虛者，令血止息瘡得平復。」
translation: At the time, Kāśyapa, a man of great longevity and ten powers, made a great vow with true words, "Suppose the Bhagavān were to imagine that all sentient beings are children, and that's really not true, so that the bleeding will stop and the sores will calm down."

source_sentence: 作是願已，血便止息瘡即除差。
translation: After making this vow, the blood stopped flowing and the sores were removed.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻、苾芻尼、鄔波索迦、鄔波斯迦及王舍城一切道俗，皆大歡喜踊躍無量。
translation: The monks, nuns, upāsaka, upāsikā, and all the religious people of Rājagṛha were overjoyed and jumped incalculably.

source_sentence: 唯提婆達多與未生怨王，并拘迦里迦惡苾芻等，心不歡喜，口云：「得病差者，誠為善哉，因此能有諸善根故。」
translation: Only Devadatta, the king of unborn enemies, and the evil monks in Kukkarika were not encouraged at heart and said, "That's really good, for someone who's gotten a laceration, and it's because of that that they can have good roots."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻皆生疑惑，唯佛世尊能斷除之。
translation: The monks then all had doubts and confusions, which only the Bhagavān could remove.

source_sentence: 諸苾芻白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The monks said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 有何因緣？
translation: What are the causes and conditions?

source_sentence: 十力迦攝發誓願已，血流止息瘡得除差。」
translation: After the ten powers of the Kāśyapa vow, the blood flow will stop and the sores will be removed."

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「非但今日有此因緣，過去世時亦有此事。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Not only does this cause and condition exist today, but it also happened in a past life.

source_sentence: 汝應諦聽！
translation: All of you should listen closely!

source_sentence: 乃往過去我被毒瘡，彼發實語已得除差。
translation: "In the past, I was struck by a poisonous sore, and he spoke truly and was able to remove it.

source_sentence: 乃往昔時於一山野有一大村，去村不遠有大叢林，多饒根果。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a large village in a mountainous region, and not far from that village there was a large jungle with lots of fruit and roots.

source_sentence: 異類諸鳥在此栖遊，出和雅音甚可愛樂。
translation: Different kinds of birds roamed there, producing a pleasant, peaceful sound.

source_sentence: 有一仙人止住其中，但食根菓飲清流水，被樹皮衣專持神呪，於此村內有一長者，在於宗族娶一女人，以為夫妻共為歡樂，於後不久妻便有娠。
translation: There was an immortal who lived there, eating only roots and fruits and drinking clear running water, wearing bark robes, and upholding a sacred spell.

source_sentence: 歲月滿已誕生一子，滿三七日設會立名，字之喜樂。
translation: When the year is up, he gives birth to a son, and when the thirty-seventh day is up, he establishes a name for it and calls it joy and happiness.

source_sentence: 長成已，或時經行、或時坐臥、常思善事、常行善業。
translation: When he's grown up, sometimes he walks, sometimes he sits or lies down, always thinking about good things and always doing good actions.

source_sentence: 時彼村人見彼喜樂號名法愛，謂求善故。
translation: The people of that village then see that Joy and Bliss and call him Dharma Love, which means he seeks goodness.

source_sentence: 時時往詣仙人所承事供養，眾人見彼愛樂仙人勤修練行，復號其名以為練行。
translation: They then went to the sage to serve and make offerings, and when the people saw that delightful sage diligently cultivating his practice, they also called his name Cultivating Practice.

source_sentence: 當於後時彼長者子身患毒瘡，以種種藥及諸呪法療治不差，然其父母將子共往詣仙人所白言：『仙人！
translation: It was then that the elder's son, who was suffering from a venomous sore and had been treated with various medicines and incantations, went to the sage with his parents and said, 'Sage!

source_sentence: 侍者今患瘡極困，當願療治。』
translation: Now, my servant is suffering from an extremely difficult sore, so I must vow to treat it.'

source_sentence: 時彼仙人即作實語發願：『今此長者子，於親於怨皆生平等無有異心。
translation: The recluse then made a true vow, 'Now, this elderly man's son has no different thoughts about his relatives or enemies.

source_sentence: 若是實言，毒當除愈。』
translation: If he truly says this, the poison will be healed.'

source_sentence: 發此願已，毒瘡當時即得除愈。」
translation: After making this vow, the venomous sores were instantly healed."

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「汝意云何？
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks, "What do you think?

source_sentence: 爾時長者子者，即我身是。
translation: At the time, that was the eldest son, which was my body.

source_sentence: 時仙人者，即十力大迦葉身是，於彼時中為發真實願故，病得除愈；今時亦復如是。」
translation: That sage, who was the ten-powered Mahākāśyapa, was healed of his illness because he made a true vow; so it is now."

source_sentence: 時提婆達多意生悔過：「我於喬答摩沙門，以石擊打不能損害，無益於事，眾人皆知虛獲惡名。」
translation: Devadatta then repented, "At the Chautama school, I was unable to harm myself by striking it with a stone, which didn't help matters, and people knew that I had falsely obtained a bad reputation."

source_sentence: 其提婆達多即於樹下，結跏趺坐諦自思惟。
translation: Thereupon, Devadatta sat cross-legged under a tree and reflected on himself.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻見提婆達多已，各共籌量思惟議論：「提婆達多於如來所有如是嗔恨，以石擊打如來。」
translation: When the monks saw Devadatta, they each considered, deliberated, and discussed, "Devadatta had such anger toward the Tathāgata that he struck him with a stone."

source_sentence: 時孤迦里迦苾芻是提婆達多朋友，告諸苾芻：「汝具壽等不能諦思非語即語，汝等不見提婆達多今在彼樹住於四禪，是大人者不作惡事。」
translation: Krakucchanda, a friend of Devadatta's, then addressed the monks, "You Kauśālī cannot truly contemplate what's not said, and you haven't seen Devadatta now abiding in the fourth dhyāna in that tree, a great man who doesn't do evil."

source_sentence: 時苾芻等心生疑惑，唯佛世尊能斷疑惑。
translation: The monks then had doubts in their minds, and the Bhagavān alone was able to end those doubts.

source_sentence: 諸苾芻白佛言，如上所說。
translation: The monks said to the Buddha, 'As I've explained above.'

source_sentence: 時提婆達多朋友苾芻孤迦里迦等見白佛已，訶諸苾芻：「汝等自無羞恥，即說我提婆達多云作惡事。」
translation: When the friends of Devadatta, the monks Kukkarika and the others saw and told the Buddha, they reprimanded the monks, "You yourselves are not ashamed to say that I, Devadatta, have done something bad."

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「孤迦里迦往昔之時亦復即說無羞恥事。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Kauṇḍinya also used to say that he was shameless.

source_sentence: 汝等諦聽！
translation: All of you, listen closely!

source_sentence: 如往昔之時，於王舍城有王，先立勅條令事王人，置兩摩舍那：一著丈夫、一著婦人。
translation: "It was once upon a time in the city of Rājagṛha that a king first established a rule ordering those who served the king to place two māṣasana: one for husbands and one for women.

source_sentence: 丈夫屍林著女婦，女婦屍林著丈夫。
translation: The husband's corpse was placed in the forest with the woman, and the woman's corpse was placed in the husband's forest.

source_sentence: 爾時後有一黃門死，將往深摩舍那，其丈夫屍林守人不令放著，其婦女屍林亦不聽著，二俱無處。
translation: It was then that a certain yellow recluse who had died and was about to go to a deep mohajana was not allowed to be placed by the guardian of the husband's corpse forest, nor was the woman's corpse forest allowed to be placed by the guardian of the woman's corpse forest; there was nowhere for either to go.

source_sentence: 於王舍城不遠，有一林所，花樹林菓茂盛可愛，有諸雜鳥出和雅音。
translation: Not far from Rājagṛha, there was a grove with a lovely profusion of flowering trees and a variety of birds that produced a harmonious sound.

source_sentence: 有一仙人居止其中，根菓為食飲清泉水被樹皮衣。
translation: An immortal lives there, feeding on fruit and drink from the clear water, wearing a bark robe.

source_sentence: 近彼方所耕地之處，有楩麻樹，其人將此死屍置楩麻樹下。
translation: Nearby, there's a (tree) that cultivates land, and that person puts this dead corpse under a (tree).

source_sentence: 時有野犴聞死屍臭，尋氣而來即食死人。
translation: A wild jail then smells the corpse's odor, searches for its breath, and comes to eat the dead man.

source_sentence: 有一老烏在於楩麻樹上藏隱而住，便自思惟：『我今好讚野犴，彼應與我少多飡食。』
translation: An old crow was staying hidden up in the (hemp) tree, and he thought to himself, 'Now that I've praised that wild jail, he'll give me a little food.'

source_sentence: 老烏以頌讚曰：「『汝胸如師子，　　腰復似牛王；　　我禮獸中主，　　與我食飡者。』
translation: The old crow praised him with a verse, saying, 'Your chest is like a lion, and your waist is like that of a king of cattle; I worship the lord of beasts, and he'll give me food to eat.'

source_sentence: 「爾時野犴遍觀察已，以頌答曰：「『誰居叢上樹，　　後生中最勝；　　身色照諸處，　　如寶作一團。』
translation: "After surveying him, the wild jail replied with a verse, 'Who lives in a grove of trees, the best of the latter? His body shape shines everywhere, like a mass of treasure?'

source_sentence: 「老烏又以頌讚曰：「『我多有用具，　　故為見汝來；　　今我禮獸王，　　有殘食與我。』
translation: "The old crow also praised him with a verse, saying, 'I have many implements, so I came to see you. Now, I've paid homage to the king of beasts, and there's leftover food for me.'

source_sentence: 「野犴還以頌答曰：「『汝項如孔雀，　　烏鳥甚可愛；　　聲鳴最勝妙，　　任汝來取食。』
translation: "Jail replied with a verse, 'Your neck is like a peacock; a crow is very desirable; your voice is most excellent; you can come and get your food.'

source_sentence: 「時烏下樹，共彼野犴同食死人。
translation: "The crow then descended from the tree and shared the same meal with the wild jail, which was to eat the dead man.

source_sentence: 彼仙人見已，還作頌曰：「『多時見汝等，　　共合無羞者；　　樹中最上音，　　所食人中賤。』
translation: When that sage saw them, he also wrote a verse, 'I've seen you often, united with them, without shame; you have the highest voice among trees, and what you eat is low among humans.'

source_sentence: 「老烏聞此語已，復以頌答曰：「『師子孔雀飡，　　共食最上者；　　禿人於此來，　　關爾何物事？』
translation: "When the old crow heard this, he replied with a verse, 'The lion, the peacock, takes a meal together with the most excellent one. What's the matter with that baldie who's here?'

source_sentence: 「爾時仙人嗔已，還以頌答曰：「『老烏鳥中卑，　　野犴獸中賤；　　楩麻不堪樹，　　黃門人中下。
translation: "After the sage became angry, he replied with a verse, 'The old crow is inferior among birds, the wild jail is inferior among animals, the (hemp) is beyond the tree, and the yellow gate is inferior among humans.

source_sentence: 地中三角醜，　　看此不識羞。』
translation: The triangle in the earth is ugly; they don't know shame when they look at it.'

source_sentence: 「時老烏起大嗔心，即往仙人祭火壇中，四邊觀望無可損處，以糞污其壇中，撥水瓶破便即走去。
translation: "The old crow then became very angry and went to the sage's fire altar, looked around to see no place to harm him, defiled the altar with dung, pulled out a water bottle, broke it, and left.

source_sentence: 時彼仙人歸來，唯見祭火壇中糞穢不淨、水瓶被撥打破。
translation: When he returned, the sage saw only that the fire altar was soiled and impure, and that the water bottle had been broken.

source_sentence: 仙人觀察，乃知是烏糞穢及打破水瓶，即說頌曰：「『如彼獰惡物，　　無羞多嗔者；　　壞我祭火壇，　　復打水瓶碎。
translation: Observing this, the sage knew it was a crow's dung and a broken water jar, so he spoke a verse, "Such is that vicious creature, shameless and wrathful, that destroys my fire altar and breaks a water jar.

source_sentence: 是類非是類，　　一切莫共言；　　應言少共說，　　無言最安樂。』」
translation: Don't say anything together about this kind or that kind; speak little together, and you'll be most comfortable without words.'"

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告諸苾芻：「汝意云何。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "What do you think?

source_sentence: 爾時仙人者，即我身是。
translation: At the time, that was the sage, which was me.

source_sentence: 老烏者，提婆達多是。
translation: That old crow is Devadatta.

source_sentence: 彼朋友者，惡苾芻孤迦里迦是，於此時中非是而說、無羞而說。」
translation: That friend, the miserable monk Kṛkālika, was not speaking thus and was not ashamed to speak at that time."

source_sentence: 爾時諸苾芻心生疑惑：「唯願世尊廣說因緣，世尊共提婆達多，宿世以來因何有惡？」
translation: The monks then had this doubt in their minds, "May the Bhagavān explain in detail the causes and conditions that led to the Bhagavān and Devadatta's past lives having evil in them?"

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告諸苾芻：「汝等諦聽！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "All of you, listen closely!

source_sentence: 乃往昔時近此海邊有一共命之鳥，一身兩頭：一鳥名法、一名非法。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a bird of two lives near the edge of this ocean: a bird named Dharma and a bird named non-dharma.

source_sentence: 其非法鳥當時眠睡，法鳥眠覺，見流水上有一甘菓，逐流而來嘴以取之，作是念：『彼既睡眠，我今欲喚睡覺共食？
translation: While the non-faithful bird was asleep and the faithful bird was asleep, he saw a sweet fruit floating in the water and came upstream to take it with his mouth, thinking, 'Now that he's asleep, do I want to call him to sleep and eat with him?'

source_sentence: 為復自食？』
translation: in order to feed oneself again?'

source_sentence: 復作是念：『為同一身，我若食已彼亦得飽。』
translation: Again, he thinks, 'For the sake of being with you, if I eat, they'll also be fed.'

source_sentence: 即便食之。
translation: He then ate it.

source_sentence: 後時非法睡覺已，見法有異復聞香氣，怪而問曰：『是何香氣？』
translation: Later, after he had fallen asleep, he saw something different in the Dharma and smelled an odor, so he wondered, 'What's that odor?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我食甘菓。』
translation: He answered, 'I ate sweet fruit.'

source_sentence: 復問：『菓今何在？』
translation: Again, he asked, 'Where's the fruit now?'

source_sentence: 報言：『非法！
translation: The retribution says, 'Unlawful!

source_sentence: 為汝睡眠，此已食訖。』
translation: I was asleep for you, and I've finished eating.'

source_sentence: 答曰：『如汝所作非是好也，我自知時。』
translation: He replied, 'Such as what you did was not good; I knew it myself when it was done.'

source_sentence: 後時法鳥眠睡之次，非法見一毒菓於水上流，引嘴往取食之，二俱迷悶心狂昏亂。
translation: Afterward, while the Dharma bird was sleeping, Nandika saw a poisonous fruit running on water and drew his mouth toward it to eat it, and they were both confused and mentally disturbed.

source_sentence: 爾時非法即設誓言：『當來所生之處生生世世，共汝相害常共為怨。』
translation: It was then that Fa didn't make a vow, 'Where we'll be born in the future, we'll be born for generations to come, and we'll always be enemies with you.'

source_sentence: 時法答曰：『願我生生世世，常共汝為善友。』」
translation: The Dharma then replied, 'May I always be a good friend to you in birth and age.'"

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告諸苾芻：「汝意云何？
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, "What do you think?

source_sentence: 時法鳥者即我身是，非法者即提婆達多是，於彼時中始生怨結，我常行利益之心，天授常懷損害之意。」
translation: At the time, the Dharma bird was myself, and the non-dharma bird was Devadatta, and it was during that time that the bond of enmity first arose, and I was always acting in a way that benefited me, while the gods always had the intention of harming me."

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「乃往過去於婆羅痆斯有王名曰白膠香，統化其國，其國豐熟人民熾盛，皆得安樂。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Once upon a time in the past, there was a king named Baeghang who ruled a country that was abundant and whose people flourished and were made happy.

source_sentence: 近彼國界有一王女，共為婚娶，娛樂遊戲住此歡樂。
translation: Nearby, there was a woman from that king's territory who married a man, entertained him, and lived here in bliss.

source_sentence: 後時懷妊乃生一女，其女漸漸長大。
translation: Later, when she was pregnant, a daughter was born to her, and she gradually grew larger.

source_sentence: 乃復有娠，月滿以後便生一子，形貌端嚴人所樂見。
translation: She then became pregnant again, and when the months were up, she gave birth to a son whose appearance was so dignified that people were delighted to see him.

source_sentence: 親族聚會，為子召諸臣議論，為彼日初出時生其孩子，故號名初。
translation: When a gathering of relatives gathered, they summoned ministers to discuss the child's birth when the sun first rises, so they called it first.

source_sentence: 付八乳母侍養孩子(廣如前說)，如是將養用諸乳酪生酥醍醐等，其子如蓮花在水速疾長大。
translation: He gives eight nursemaids to nurture the child (as explained in detail above) and thus nurtures him with milk, cheese, butter, and ghee, and his child grows up quickly like a lotus flower in water.

source_sentence: 後令入學，教其文字曆數算計，種種伎藝工巧之法、乘象之事，弓弩箭射等法、王法之事，皆悉明解。
translation: He then sent him to school and taught him how to write, calendrical calculations, various arts and crafts, riding an elephant, shooting a bow and arrow, and the king's laws, all of which he fully understood.

source_sentence: 後時老王立為太子。
translation: The old king then made him the crown prince.

source_sentence: 老王先有一上宮王妃名曰達摩，復有一大臣名曰宰牛，老王甚大怜愛倚付其臣。
translation: The old king had an upper palace princess named Dharma and another minister named Zainu, whom the old king greatly loved and entrusted with his ministers.

source_sentence: 時王共上宮遊戲，後時懷妊，相師占之必生一子，當定殺王自取王位。
translation: The king then went up to the palace to play together, and when she became pregnant, a fortune teller divined that she would surely give birth to a son who would surely kill the king and take the throne for himself.

source_sentence: 後時王患，用諸根苗葉花菓種種藥草醫療，病不能除。
translation: The king then became ill and was treated with a variety of medicinal plants made from roots, seeds, leaves, flowers, and fruits, but his illness couldn't be cured.

source_sentence: 大王便作是念：『今須建立太子安住王位，我若死後太子必殺我上宮。』
translation: The king then thought, 'Now we must establish a prince to stay on the throne; if I die, the prince will kill me and take me up to the palace.'

source_sentence: 復作是念：『我作何計挍？』
translation: Again, he thought, 'What do I plan to do about it?'

source_sentence: 即喚太臣平章，多與受用資具財物，便寄達摩分付臣邊，令其覆護，告言：『汝是我親近大臣，其達摩夫人者，是我親近夫人。
translation: He then summoned the minister, Vipaśyin, to give him much in the way of provisions and goods for use, and then sent Dharman to one of his ministers to guard him, telling him, 'You're a minister close to me, and that Dharmaness is a wife close to me.

source_sentence: 我今自知身決定死，若死已後太子正住位時，汝應慈念當須擁護，莫令殺却達摩夫人。』
translation: Now, I myself know that I'm determined to die, but if the prince were to take his place after my death, you should have the compassion to protect her and not allow her to be killed.'

source_sentence: 臣白王言：『我作如是，必不令殺達摩夫人。』
translation: The minister said to the king, 'Thus will I do, and I will not allow Lady Dharma to be killed.'

source_sentence: 王即說頌言：「『積聚皆消散，　　崇高必墮落；　　合會終別離，　　有命咸歸死。』
translation: The king then spoke the verse, saying, 'The heap of accumulation will dissipate, the lofty will fall, the union will end in separation, and all human life will end in death.'

source_sentence: 「說此頌已即便命終。
translation: "After speaking this verse, he was about to die.

source_sentence: 作諸幡花寶塔殯王已了，便建立太子為大王。
translation: After he had made banners, flowers, and a jeweled stūpa to bury the king, he then established the crown prince as great king.

source_sentence: 根本說一切有部毘奈耶破僧事卷第十八
translation: Mūlasarvâstivāda-vinaya-viṃśati-vāda, vol. 18
